result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L Hubbard Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Hubbard to 2 years of Incarceration, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision 6 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

****Per 3-30-2016 ORDER  JOC is Amended to reflect that the Defendant is not eleigble for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program/Earned Release Program****

superMiscConds.notes:
--Complete a Certified Batterers Intervention and follow throught as recommended; this is to be made available to Mr. Hubbard during confinement period
--to provide a DNA sample
--No Contact with the victim,
--No presence within 1000 feet of the victim's residence, place of employment or place of education

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Per Judge Wambach, the intent of his 1/5/16 record was that the case transfer to Branch 4, if there was an agreement by Branch 4 to conduct the Sentencing Hearing.
from DOC requesting clarification of the Court's sentence
Transcript of Sentencing Hearing on Revocation held on 1/1/16 before Judge Koschnick
Copy of DNA Proof of Submission form completed by JCSD

Cases 14CF366 and 15CM307 called together at 1:35pm [mo]
As to Case 14CF366(Sentencing Hearing on Revocation occurs) and As to Case 15CM307(Sentencing Hearing occurs)
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On revocation order and warrant of Case 14CF366; no factual corrections
--Atty. Dahnert raises the accuracy of prior criminal record

As to Case 15CM307:The Court finds that Defendant has been properly been charged as a repeater

As to Both Cases: 
Sentencing arguments made by Counsel
--Statement made by B.K.
--Statement made by Mr. Hubbard

As to Case 15CM307:
The Court sentences Mr. Hubbard to 2 years of Incarceration, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision 6 months. 
This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp". 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. The Court gives 137 days credit for time already served. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision: 
--Complete a Certified Batterers Intervention and follow throught as recommended; this is to be made available to Mr. Hubbard during confinement period
--to pay Court Costs
--to provide a DNA sample
--No Contact with the victim,
--No presence within 1000 feet of the victim's residence, place of employment or place of education

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant


As to Case 14CF366:
On Count #3 the Court sentences Defendant to: 
--serve 9 months in the County Jail, concurrent to sentence in Counts #4 and #5 and concurrent to the sentence in case 15CM307

On Count #4 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in the County Jail, concurrent to sentence in Counts #3 and #5 and concurrent to the sentence in case 15CM307

On Count #5 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in the County Jail, concurrent to sentence in Counts #3 and #4 and concurrent to the sentence in case 15CM307

--As to Case 14CF366 the Court orders all costs and fees to be coverted to civil judgement against Mr. Hubbard
--137 days credit for time already served given 
recess: 2:15pm
Sentencing hearing at 01-14-2016 01:30 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Reginald L. Hubbard
Current: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2016)
Prior: 8885 S. 68th St, C/O Milwaukee House of Corrections, Franklin, WI 53132 United States
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 10:21am [mo]
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; Atty. Dahnert notes that victim is present in the gallery.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts#2 and #3.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
On agreement of Parties, if Branch 4 Judge is willing to accept this case, the sentencing of this case should occur of the date of sentencing after revocation in Case 14CF366.
recess: 10:37am
Status conference at 01-05-2016 09:00 am

Case called at 10:32am [mo]
Defendant, Reginald Hubbard Jr. does NOT appear in court
Attorney Sylvie Dahnert in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record.
Atty. Dahnert indicates that Mr. Hubbard Jr. is in custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections and failed to notify the State of Mr. Hubbard's new address.
The Court adjourns this Status Conference.
The Court directs that Mr. Hubbard Jr. is to appear by video if available, if not the State is to prepare a Writ 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 10:36am

NEXT: Status Conference on 1/5/16 at 9:00am
Change of address submitted by Attorney Dahnert
Status conference at 10-27-2015 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 09-23-2015 10:40 am
Attorney Sylvie Dahnert
Scheduling Notice
Probable Cause Statement

[MK] case called at 1:38pm. 
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Brianna Kurtz
--no presence at 201 N. Concord Avenue in Watertown 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any weapons as defined by Statute [Statute 939.22(10)]
recess 1:43pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/23/15 at 10:40am.  (2) Status Conference on 10/27/15 at 10:30am.
